meanings.definition: To combine or include something as part of a whole.
meanings.sent1: I will incorporate your ideas into our project.
meanings.sent2: She decided to incorporate healthy habits into her daily routine.
meanings.sent3: The recipe called for me to incorporate the flour slowly, but I accidentally dumped it all in at once!
meanings.sent4: His artwork beautifully incorporates elements of nature and technology.
meanings.sent5: The dance routine will incorporate a mix of classical and modern styles.

meanings.sent1: They plan to incorporate their business next year.
meanings.sent2: The entrepreneurs decided to incorporate to protect their assets.
meanings.sent3: The small town decided to incorporate to have their own local government.
meanings.sent4: The company will incorporate in order to expand its operations.
meanings.sent5: In order to grow, the startup will incorporate and seek investors.

meanings.definition: To embody or give physical form to something.
meanings.sent1: The artist wanted to incorporate her emotions into her sculpture.
meanings.sent2: The architect will incorporate sustainable design principles into the building.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's suit was designed to incorporate special powers.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to incorporate all the joy in the world.
meanings.sent5: The new product will incorporate cutting-edge technology for better performance.
